arts.ttl: The unlikely Liverpool leader Slot must entrust after Brentford defeat - opinion
arts.sum: Give him the keys and let him drive!

arts.ttl: Virgil van Dijk acknowledged he has to ‘look in the mirror’ after defeat to Brentford
arts.sum: Tough to take but it's the reality and we need to keep going." We have the next game on Wednesday against an opponent [ Crystal Palace ] who already made our life difficult this season.

arts.ttl: Why Liverpool's defending against Brentford was 'unacceptable'
arts.sum: Match of the Day pundit Ashley Williams says Liverpool's defending against Brentford was "not good enough" and resulted in an "unacceptable" goal for Kevin Schade.

arts.ttl: Brentford 3-2 Liverpool: Rattled Reds Remain in Crisis
arts.sum: Mo Salah scored a consolation effort, and there was a crazed, final flurry from the guests, but Brentford seemed as if they could score at will for the most part, and they walked away with all three points at full time. Mamardashvili did not decisively deal with a delivery, and Ouattara ballooned a header over the bar after a string of second balls went the way of the Bees .

arts.ttl: Jordan Henderson issues challenge to Brentford after victorious Liverpool reunion
arts.sum: It was the midfielder’s first meeting with his former club since he moved away in 2023

arts.ttl: Liverpool: Arne Slot makes worrying admission after Brentford defeat
arts.sum: The Reds have now lost four consecutive Premier League matches

arts.ttl: Brentford were 'fearless' in significant win over Liverpool - Andrews
arts.sum: Brentford Manager Keith Andrews credits his side's "fearless" attitude when facing Liverpool to win 3-2.

arts.ttl: Brentford condemn lacklustre Liverpool to fourth straight league defeat
arts.athr: Jonathan Wilson at the Gtech Community Stadium
arts.sum: Victory in Frankfurt on Wednesday, it turns out, was only temporary respite. Liverpool didn’t just slip to a fourth league defeat in a row for the first time since February 2021, but were thoroughly outplayed and outfought by Brentford. The anxious period of stoppage time the home side endured was out of keeping with everything that had gone before. Brentford tend naturally to a direct approach anyway, but Arne Slot’s grumbling last week about Manchester United’s long balls was an open invitation. Liverpool never got to grips with the pace of Kevin Schade running in behind their back four, and they looked uncomfortable as well against Michael Kayode’s fusillade of long throws. Every side now knows that Liverpool are vulnerable to balls played in behind their full-backs. The opening goal, scored after five minutes, stemmed from a Kayode throw, but that was the result of Giorgi Mamardashvili, mopping up as Schade chased behind Conor Bradley. It was already the second time he had done so. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Liverpool suffer fourth PL defeat in a row at Brentford
arts.sum: Brentford outfought and outclassed Liverpool to earn a 3-2 victory over the Premier League champions.

arts.ttl: Liverpool Player Ratings vs. Brentford: Slot Taunted in 22-Year Nadir
arts.sum: The bright hope offered by a midweek Champions League win was extinguished by Brentford.
